fields.summary: Since 2010, {images} images were annotated with {taggings} tags by {users} players.

fields.cis: Center for Information and Language Processing

texts.2008: Gerhard Schön (IT-Group Humanities) develops a first prototype of the social tagging platform ARTigo as a proof-of-concept.
texts.2010: ARTigo is funded by the German Research Foundation (DFG). Under the direction of Hubertus Kohle (Institute for Art History), François Bry (Institute for Informatics), Thomas Krefeld (Institute for Romance Studies), Klaus Schulz (Center for Information and Language Processing) and Christian Riepl (IT-Group Humanities) are realising the project.
texts.2012: Der Spiegel presents the platform in the article “Lass das mal den Schwarm machen”.
texts.2018: As part of the Stadt-Land-Bild-project, ARTigo can be played in the Austrian Museum of Folk Life and Folk Art via a multimedia installation consisting of extensive touch-screen walls.
texts.2021: Under the directon of Stefanie Schneider (Institute for Art History), ARTigo is being re-designed and adapted to the technical state-of-the-art.
